file_content.text: It's done.
That blade is part of you, now. The next time you face Arcann in battle, he will not be ready for you.
A new path has opened, thanks to you. Our duty is to follow it.
Nothing's more important than staying to help me defeat Arcann.
My Alliance needs you.
Our time has passed. This is your war to fight.
You can't leave. You've barely told me anything I need to know.
But I still have questions.
Trust in the path ahead. Your Alliance... and the Force... awaits its Commander. Farewell.
We've shown you many things. What do you plan to do with our knowledge? Can you follow the will of the Force?
You said the Force is a paradox. If that's true, then it has no will worth following. I'll make my own way through this.
My will is all that matters.
Nothing you told me has shaken my belief in the Jedi path. If this was a test, you'll have to try harder.
I'll honor the Jedi Code.
If you thought you could sway me from the only true path to power, you're as misguided as you are broken. I am Sith.
I'll still obey the Sith code.
The enemy may have changed, but the reason I fight hasn't. I defend the Republic's freedom. Always have, always will.
I'll preserve the Republic.
Zakuul's just as childish and confused as the Republic. The Empire is my home--and Arcann isn't taking it away from me.
I'll defend the Empire.
Whatever the Force has in store for me, I'm ready for it. I have a destiny.
Yes... wherever it leads.
Your way is clear, and so is ours. Do you feel it, Marr? The Force draws us... elsewhere.
You know what must be done. That's enough.
I'll get back to saving the galaxy. You two, do... whatever it is you're doing--far, far away from me.
Go, then. I don't need you.
You aren't leaving. I'm dealing with you here, now--before you become a threat.
No. [Kill Satele Shan.]
I understand.
It's not my time to die. Not yet.
I'll find you... someday.
The weapon you wield was built for a different war. A different enemy. It no longer serves you. It must change, as you have.
You brought me here to build a lightsaber.
You want me to build a new lightsaber.
You will create a pure extension of the Force's will--one you alone control. With it, you can unite a thousand stars.
We offer to add our strength to yours, but you must be the guiding hand. Focus the power, and decide what form it takes.
I'm ready when you are.
Let's begin.
I don't need help. I can stand on my own.
I'll do this by myself.
Then you are ready.
We're doing this my way. I don't need a Jedi and Sith confusing things. One of you has to go.
Only one of you can help.
As you wish. Who should remain?
You've changed, Satele--but I still prefer the living to the dead.
You can stay. Marr, keep out.
So be it.
Darth Marr has proven he's stronger than death itself. That's the kind of power I need.
I want Marr's help, not yours.
Very well.
There's no defeat I can't overcome....
[Focus on resilience.]
There's no limit I can't surpass....
[Focus on transcendence.]
There's no loss I can't survive....
[Focus on sacrifice.]
The exile on Odessen is over.
Poor Theron.
I fought Arcann's sister. Vaylin was right here....
No. That was merely a warning. A vision.
You do not use the Force, but Valkorion's power lets you glimpse through it.
A bond to the Force as intense as yours brings with it powerful insight.
Heed what you saw. Behind Arcann stands Vaylin... and behind her, many others. They will all try to stop you.
The devices I found out there... I can build a new weapon with them.
Much more than that--a projection of your will. Wield it wisely, and you will unite the stars beneath your own banner.
That weapon is part of you, now. The next time you face Arcann in battle, he will not be ready for it.
But violence can only destroy. It doesn't inspire others to greatness, and it can never rebuild. Only a leader can do that.
I once thought it enough to be the unstoppable force between my people and the enemy.
I faced Valkorion and refused to bend. That choice broke me--and doomed the worlds I sought to defend.
I sent Jedi to fight an enemy I didn't understand, because I believed in the justness of my cause. Those deaths still haunt me.
We know what it means to fail those who counted on us. We would spare you that pain.
It's better for me to learn from your mistakes than repeat them.
Your advice is helpful.
I've been a leader before. I know what it takes to win a war.
This isn't my first army.
You failed and fell apart--in Marr's case, literally. That doesn't mean I'll do the same.
Spare me your whining.
Your brief time as the Supreme Commander of Jedi forces on Corellia tested you, and exposed your limitations.
Your skill preventing the Rift Alliance from leaving the Republic was impressive, but the challenges you face now are far more complex.
Havoc Squad achieved great things as a small team under your command, but this is different.
You were respected in the galactic underworld. You briefly commanded the Voidwolf's mercenary fleet. But you've never truly served anyone except yourself.
As the Wrath, you were always forced to stand alone. You planned and executed without regard for others.
Your onetime power base was impressive, but in the end you were still only one facet of the Dark Council.
You have spent your life among mercenaries fighting for honor, or wealth. The people serving you now have far more complex motivations.
Imperial Intelligence taught you how to manipulate others from the shadows, but you cannot rule that way forever.
Leading this Alliance is unlike anything you have done before. Directing the war effort is a mere fraction of the burden you must bear.
You must not only know when to fight, but when to retreat--or even to make peace with your foe.
There is an oasis not far from this cave. Your final lesson waits there.
You killed her children. She will devour you as revenge.
What hope do you have to escape such raw fury?
I don't need to escape. I only need to fight.
[Fight the beast.]
Escape isn't always possible.
[Try to calm the beast.]
If you accept that death has power over you, it stops being your enemy... and becomes an ally.
When that happens... you don't have to fight.
[Stand your ground.]
You killed your enemy and claimed its home... for now.
You created peace from a violent confrontation. Impressive.
Some believe you're destined to walk this path. Others think you make the choices that decide their fates.
Your Alliance will collapse if you do not know yourself--and the ideal you serve. Do you understand?
Whatever fate has in store for me and the Alliance, I'm ready.
Destiny guides me.
There is no destiny. My choices make all the difference.
My will is all that matters.
Trust in the path ahead. The Alliance awaits its Commander. Farewell.
